desc.html:
• Author: scanned by David Croll (username Keimzelle on en.wikipedia.org)
  • Source: a ballot
  • Fair use reason: this work does not surpass the threshold of originality because it is a simple means of creating a ballot according to the rule of law. Uh, perhaps the coat of arms could be copyrighted. Please correct the license tag if appropriate.

I called a responsible at the federal office and he explained that its allowed to use ballot scans on the Wikipedia as long as the ballot concerned is for a past referendum/election.--Keimzelle 13:33, 23 December 2006 (UTC)


SWISS CONFEDERATION

Ballot for the popular referendum on 26th November 2006

Do you want to accept the federal law from 24th March 2006 on the Collaboration with the countries of East Europe?

(with the possibility of writing the answer "Yes", "No" or writing nothing whatsoever in the box; "Antwort" = answer)

Do you want to accept the federal law from 24th March 2006 on the family subsidies (Family subsidies law)?

(again, with the same possibilities answering)
